title: Is Geth v1.8.27 incompatible with Solidity 0.5.0?

body: Looking at your transaction's receipt, it seems you forgot to enable some EIPs in the genesis, in particular I can't see the `status` flag so you forgot at least Byzantium. Try to enable all current EIPs (Homestead,  DAO, EIP150, EIP155, EIP158, Byzantium, Constantinople, ConstantinopleFix) and check the result.
@Neurone Thank you so much! I got it.

Try to enable ConstantinopleBlock in the genesis.json file. I solved the problem by doing so. Hope it helps.

> 在 2019年7月30日，上午7:48，Janly <notifications@github.com> 写道：
> 
> @mynamedaike <https://github.com/mynamedaike> i was same problem，how to solve it and use 0.5 up?
> 
> —

> @Neurone Thank you so much! I got it.

Could you please tell me what did u figure out @mynamedaike. If you added constantinople in your genesis.json. Please give me the code. Because for me even with the constantinople enabled, its not working in solidity versions 5 and above
